name: Mini Leave-In Molecular Repair Hair Mask
categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Hair Masks
about: What it is:A leave-in treatment mask for all hair types that clinically reverses damage in four minutes. The patented peptide technology works to repair damage from bleach, color, chemical services, and heat, restoring strength, softness, smoothness, and bounce to hair..Hair Type:Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Texture:Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily.Hair Concerns:- Damage/Split Ends/Breakage.Key Benefits:- Restores strength, softness, smoothness, and bounce.Highlighted Ingredients:- K18Peptide™: Repairs damage from bleach, color, chemical services, and heat..Ingredient Callouts:This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:This mask is powered by the patented K18Peptide, which is just the right size and molecular structure to reach the innermost layers of hair and re-connect broken keratin chains responsible for hair's strength and elasticity..Fragrance Description:The light floral scent features notes of jasmine and peony...Clinical Results:In a clinical study on hair that was bleached 8 times, after 2 uses:
ingredients: -K18Peptide™: Repairs damage from bleach, color, chemical services, and heat...Water (Aqua) (Eau), Alcohol Denat., Propylene Glycol, Cetearyl Alcohol, Dicaprylyl Ether, Cetyl Esters, Behentrimonium Chloride, Polysorbate 20, sh-Oligopeptide-78 (K18Peptide), Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Hydrolyzed Wheat Starch, Isopropyl Alcohol, Tocopherol, Phenoxyethanol, Potassium Sorbate, Citric Acid, Fragrance (Parfum), Geraniol, Linalool, Hexyl Cinnamal, Benzyl Alcohol...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.In the shower:.-Shampoo, don‘t condition...Once out of the shower:.-Using a towel gently dry hair until damp..-Begin with one mL/one dime-size amount of K18 Mask..-Only add more as needed. Average use is two mL/two dime-size amounts (this is a highly concentrated formula, so you‘ll need much less than traditional masks)..-Work evenly into hair from ends to roots..-Let sit for four minutes to activate..-Don‘t rinse out..-Style as usual after the four minutes is up (fine to add heat protectant or styling product now)..-Use for the first four to six washes, then swap to maintenance mode and use as needed.

reviews.review_text: In my opinion, K18 is better for bond building / treating damaged hair (especially bleached) than other brands. However, I don’t *really* believe the claim it’s made for all hair types. I have very fine,  high porosity bleached hair (full bleach —> base bump + highlights ) which is curly pattern mix of 3A/3B curls, and isn’t super thick.   My main issue is that 1-3 pumps is simply not enough for my hair. The directions state to use sparingly, but my curl pattern and porosity NEED much more product. Probably 4-6 pumps along with other leave in products. I’ve tried this leave in with both a sparingly conservative and generous amount of product alongside cutting out / normal routine of other post-shower products. I’ve adhered to using it 4-6 washes and then switching as needed, it’s just the same occurring issue.   If I were to use just 1-2 pumps of this leave in (recommended is just 2 dime size amounts) and no other products after showering, my hair is almost as dry as hay texture in a few hours out in a summer Midwest heat wave. The smoothness effect just doesn’t hold well; while the product does help in producing a more silky texture & appears to minimize the appearance of damage (flyaways / little hair pop ups / drying ends / hair ), that result goes away for me in probably less than 3-5ish hours.   I saw other reviews from people with curly / bleached hair that it appeared to work on; so this is just my experience. But I feel for the $$$ of the product, it’s an issue that I need to use such a heavy amount alongside various products to actually *see* results from it.   Just don’t think it’s worth the money if it’s potentially not able to adapt to various hair types! It definitely works for some people but it’s not a one size fits all.

reviews.review_text: I was really starting to worry that my hair was beyond repair, after two extremely unfortunate highlight sessions left it more damaged than it’s ever been. Since I started using k18 regularly the texture of my hair has completely changed. It’s softer, the ends look thicker, and areas where I used to have chronic breakage are actually growing back. Cannot recommend enough.  One caveat: how you apply it is so important! The first time I used it, my hair was too wet, and it didn’t really do anything. It just sat on top of my hair and made it crunchy. BUT, if you wait until your hair is partially dry and rub the product vigorously between your palms before applying, it will make a huge difference. I also only use it after shampooing—no conditioner. I sometimes use a leave in conditioner/detangler after the 4 minutes are up, but it’s not absolutely necessary.

reviews.review_text: This thing WORKS! you just have to use it properly. Do skip conditioner. BEFORE brushing my hair or doing anything to it I divide it in 2 and then 2 again. Half up and half down. I divide the bottom half in 2, I pump 2 or 3 pumps of the mini version and then I rub my hands together until the product looks white, chalky white. I apply that to my hair and then continue to do the same with the top section. I let that sit for at least 4 minutes before brushing my hair. After the wait I brush and style my hair and I swear my split ends have mended or something, there's some magic going on. It's wild! Use it 6 times in a row (after washes) and then only once a week. The instructions should be better, that's for sure, because when I first bought this mask I hated and never used it until I saw a video of someone using it how I described to you and it actually worked. If you already bought it and didn't like it, please try it again this way. If you haven't bought it yet, you should. I had so many split ends because I overuse styling tools. I bought this with my own money, not an influencer, just a regular person with an honest opinion (worth sharing!!)

I was definitely surprised and pleased when it continued to pump for multiple uses past the first six shampoos.    Flash forward to when I finally finished the mask. I drove to Sephora and decided to splurge on a second bottle for my birthday. We all know that this mask is expensive and I wanted this bottle to last even longer than the first. I mean, It should last longer because I wouldn't need to use it as often, right? I didn't over do it with the second bottle and only put the reccomended amount on the ends of my hair once every couple of weeks.  Unfortunately, this bottle was empty after a 1/2 pump on my forth use!?! That's NOT an exaggeration and I tried thinking of reasons why I might have convinced myself that the first bottle lasted longer. I'm not infallible, but it doesn't make sense. I know how much I used and even had a significant hair cut right before the second bottle I purchased. Now, I just feel cheated and there's nothing I can do about it.  Anyway, all this just to say that I'm going to stick with using Olaplex. The K18 mask did work well, but it's ridiculously overpriced and the results weren't drastic. reviews.review_text: Bought this since my hairdresser of 20 years swears by it and it always leaves my hair super-soft for weeks after the salon. Initially I followed the instructions on the package (no conditioner, apply 3 pumps, then more if needed, leave for 4 mins, then style as usual). My hair felt lank, gummy and just looked greasy and horrible - I was so frustrated that I had to wash and dry my hair all over again, and it felt even drier than before for weeks. I did some research and turns out there is completely different advice on the brand's website, which is so strange, but decided to give it another go. I skipped conditioner, used 2.5 pumps for my long balayage-blonde hair, vigorously rubbed my hands together until the product felt thicker and resembled white paint, smoothed through all my bleached areas, left at least 4 minutes, then continued with the rest of my usual hair routine. After drying my hair it felt super-soft, hydrated and so much better than before - such a contrast to the gross gummy feel it gave my hair before. I don't use it every wash, only as needed. Minus one star since it's so expensive and the packaging could be better.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: About me: - I have fine 2C/3A hair that I bleach every few months. I wash it and use heat about two times a week.  - I've gone through a few bottles of K18 over two years and currently only use it once or twice a month. - I used to follow the directions exactly, but found I got better results with the following: I wash my hair thoroughly, then dry my hair so it's not sopping. I put K18 in my hair and let it sit for the 4 minutes, then I put a hair mask on top of it. After the mask has sat for the necessary time, I rinse it out and move on with styling products. (Youtuber Abbey Yung contacted the company and they confirmed this is fine to do).  The review: So I don't think I've really seen much of a difference in my hair regarding the look and feel. However, I do feel like my hair can handle a lot more to it now. I still have breakage, but not as much as I used to have considering how damaging my routine is. It also took a long time for me to really notice this. A lot of people said after the first 6 uses, they noticed a huge difference but I honestly don't think I noticed much of a difference till well into my second bottle.  I also HATE the packaging. I don't usually care about packaging, but there is no way to tell how much product you have left right now. For $100, I'd like to at least know when I'm close to running out.  Also I'm certain this product used to be like $80 or $90CAD tops. I know the science is different, but I've definitely had more noticeable results from cheaper products out there (surprisingly, L'oreal's Acidic PH Hair Treatment has become my favourite).  TLDR: - It made my hair feel stronger, but isn't a miracle and took a long time to see results - Packaging sucks - Increasing the price with no improvement to the product also sucks

reviews.review_text: This product worked very well for me over the 4-5 months I’ve been using it. I have medium to fine curly that has never been coloured but it did have a lot of heat damage from many years of straightening(split and breaking/brittle ends and strands). Before using this I had already been getting regular haircuts plus trimming any split ends I would see on a weekly basis and using heat protectant but still found my hair to always become very damaged again so quickly, therefore it never grew. I found the K18 mask, in combination with other things I’ve already been doing like reducing the temperature a bit when I use hot tools, wearing less damaging hair styles and the trimming of split ends regularly has really overhauled the health of my hair. My hair seems to be legitimately healthy now and is FINALLY growing without becoming so broken at the ends that I just need to chop it off again when I get some length, the strands are actually stronger and shinier.  Because I have curly hair prone to dryness I thought I should mention that the way I use this is different than the instructions. I use a clarifying shampoo in the shower then get out and towel dry my hair so it’s damp, then I use K18 the way it says for 4 mins then hop back in the shower rinse it out and condition as normal. I absolutely need to condition my hair after using this or I would get damage just from my hair being too dry and I wouldn’t get any of the benefits from the product. I also only use it about once or twice a month now as opposed to the 6 consecutive washes I did at the beginning with it as instructed.  The reason I gave this 4 stars is because of the price and the size, it’s so small for how much you pay and the price also went up by over 10$ since June 2023 when I first ordered(it was $89 CAD then and now in November is just over $100.. it’s kind of ridiculous, they could’ve at least increased the amount of product you get if they’re going to raise the price by that much.

reviews.review_text: I lighten my hair every 10-12 weeks and experience dryness and damage. I'm very conflicted on this product for many reasons,  although I will admit that it has improved the appearance of my hair and it does appear smoother, which I noticed even after the first use. My typical hair routine consists of a hard water shampoo, purple shampoo and a purple toning/hydration mask. Having well water at home really affects my color so the hardwater shampoo and purple products really keep my color looking fresh.  This hair repair mask instructs to not condition before applying, which means skipping out on my purple toning hair mask.  No conditioner upon leaving the shower also resulted in my hair looking a total rats nest. I couldn't get a comb (or even get my fingers) through it. After applying the product (I used 2 pumps to start) and letting it sit, I was able to comb through it, although I still felt like I was ripping my hair out. After the first comb through,  I then applied 2 more pumps before I felt it was where it needed to be. I first noticed the improvement in the amount of damage immediately after drying my hair.  It appeared smoother and I had less fly aways. I also liked that my hair still felt light and not weighed down by product. A negative for me was that my hair seemed to not hold style as well as before and there is absolutely no scent at all to this product. Having hardwater at home leaves a metallic scent and usually my shampoo and conditioner help to dampen the scent but with this product not being scented, my hair just smells of heavy metals. Overall, I really thought this product was effective and did reduce the amount of damage in my hair, although most likely I will use every other wash in order to continue using my blonde toning mask on the other days.

reviews.review_title: I have a little tip for you :)
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product, it makes such a difference in my long, bleached hair!!! I followed Abbey Yung's (YouTube) advice by doing the following steps: 1. Wash hair twice or with a clarifying shampoo 2. Get out of the shower and towel dry your hair 3. Part hair in half, pump K18 into palm, and rub your hands together so the product on your hands turn white. Then I scrunch and rub it into my hair 1 side at a time. My hair is long so I do about 1 pump per side, then I flip my head upside down and do a half pump for the bottom half. 4. Wait the 4 minutes before hopping back into the shower. reviews.review_title: Works - But Must Use BEYOND exactly as directed
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: First off, I used this for 6 consecutive washes as per directed. I have long, blonde, fine, wavy, color-treated & damaged hair. This has made my hair feel softer, lighter, stronger, I have less breakage & my hair did not feel as dry after heat usage. But this didn't magically transform my hair; I still have some split ends and frizz, but my hair overall feels better. This is the routine I used for every K18 wash for 6 washes: 1.) No pre-shampoo oil treatment (usually I use one before every wash). 2.) Use a clarifying shampoo before K18. I used Ouai Detox Shampoo. You need to get all of the oils & other build up off your hair before putting K18 on so there's nothing blocking the K18 from penetrating your hair. DO NOT CONDITION BEFORE K18. 3.) After shampoo, I got out of the shower and I towel dried my hair with a micro-fiber towel, so my hair was still damp, but not dripping wet. 4.) I separated my hair into two sections, then used two pumps for each section (4 pumps total). I pumped 2 pumps on my hand, rubbed my hands together for 30 seconds until the K18 turned white and had an oily texture, then scrunched into one section of my hair from the bottom to the roots to ensure it was evenly applied. You do NOT want to use too much K18, this isn't a deep conditioning treatment. You just want it to make contact with your hair, not coat it. I couldn't see the K18 on my hair after I applied it. 5.) Set your timer for 4 minutes. 6.) after the 4 minutes were up, I did NOT rinse out the K18 and I put on my regular Aveda deep-moisture conditioner on directly over it. K18 has now officially come out and said you can use conditioner AFTER the 4 minute period & rinse out the conditioner as you usually would without affecting the K18. Then I continued to use my normal styling products as directed. I believe the issues people are having are due to using K18 on too wet hair, using too much K18, not dispersing it throughout the hair, & not using conditioner after use.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am very conflicted about this mask. I have extremely dry and damaged hair after years of coloring, heat styling and most of bleaching. It's left my hair feeling like horsehair so I'm always trying to find the perfect hair product to combat the dryness and damage and when I tried using this for the first time I was absolutely blown away by what it did to my hair! For the first time my hair was actually soft and shiny and manageable and I was so happy about that! I've been using it rather religiously since then, I've used it a few times in a row now 'cause they said to do that for very damaged hair the first 6-8 times and it was supposed to fix it. I don't think I've seen any long term change or anything but my hair feels pretty good for the first couple of days and looks beautiful after I've straightened it. But the reason I say I'm conflicted and the reason it only gets 3 stars is because of the ingredients! There's an ingredient that's almost the first one on the list that I am shocked they would not only put in the product to begin with but also put so much of it that it dominates over most other ingredients, and that is denatured alcohol! This is the most drying ingredient you could ever find for both your hair and skin and no one should be using it. I don't buy ANYTHING that has to do with makeup, skincare or haircare that contains it (I didn't buy this myself btw) because using this ingredient in anything that touches your skin is going to dry it out to the point that you'll be looking like an old leather bag by the time you're 40! It's the ingredient that's in the popular UD All Nighter spray for example. Crazy that more people don't know this fact! So I wouldn't get this mask again as I don't want it drying and damaging my hair and skin for an extended period of time. It's insane that they'd put the most drying ingredient out there in this mask and then claim it's supposed to help with dryness! This mask will eventually ruin your hair, that's a fact.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Totally recommend! I have thick, long hair that tends to be dry. I do color my roots, and I get Japanese straightening about every 9 months. I was using Olaplex 3 and liked it. However, I found K18 to work better for me. I used it 6 washes in a row per the instructions. I disliked it after the first use. A lot of influencers with long hair are recommending 4 pumps so I tried that, and my hair felt so weighed down but dry at the ends. I rinsed it out the next day. So less is more with this product! Since then I have used 3 pumps: divided hair in half, 1 pump on the lower ends of each side, and 1 pump for the entire top half of my hair. I do NOT emulsify it in my hands until it turns white because this rubbed in a lot of the product into my palms. I just spread it even in my palms and then apply. After 4 minutes, I detangle and use a conditioner mask and rinse after 30 minutes or so. I started seeing an improvement in smoothing, less frizz, and more shininess/reflectiveness after the 3rd usage. It also makes my hair dry faster (both air-dried or blow-dried) which was an unexpected positive effect. My hair is not softer than if I use just a conditioning mask but my ends seem to be better moisturized. Now I use K18 every 2-3 washes. I know it is expensive but the trial side is probably big enough for you to give it a good try and see if it works for you. The trial pump dispenses a different amount than the full size so start with the lowest amount recommended by K18 and then add a little more if needed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got K18 mid February and it has completely reformed my hair within 2 weeks! I followed directions:  for the first couple of weeks, take a shower, shampoo but DONT condition, towel dry and then apply K18. I know… no conditioner feels like a crime. But here’s my trick for making this work: before my shower, I brush my hair well, to detangle. Then, while shampooing, I still scrub my scalp (I use the Briogeo scalp products), but I try to use my fingers to lightly detangle while shampooing.  It won’t be anything like conditioner, but you’ll be able to detangle a little bit. Then rinse the shampoo out carefully, don’t scrub and add more knots. Next, towel dry and then I attempt to very patiently brush out my wet hair starting from the bottom, working my way up. I eventually get to the roots and then can apply 1-2 pumps of K18. I swear by it now.   I also met this amazing gay man out in LA a few weeks ago, he had the longest, shiniest hair… when I asked him his hair routine, he credited K18 and said he’d been religiously using it for about a month to get those results.   Honestly, give it a try if you can afford it, my hair hasn’t felt this good and healthy since before I started getting highlights and using heated styling tools.

The second time I used it, I did as they instructed, and I personally wouldn’t do it this way again. You also need a lot more product than they say. The tiniest bit of conditioner will save you from having to use more of this product than is necessary. I understand that they’re going for maximum penetration into the hair, but when hair is severely compromised, this is frustrating.  I also don’t like the fact that there is added protein in this, since my hair overdoses on it pretty easily. Using it alone made it more brittle. I’ll continue using it, but only mixed with other products, because it’s just too drying for me, personally. I do think the research behind the molecule is found, and hopefully they’ll come out with other formulations.

reviews.review_title: Double duty care for your hair

reviews.review_text: After hearing so much buzz about this hair mask, I was skeptical about the results. My experience with many beauty products has resulted in an inverse relationship between expectations and performance. To put this one to the test, I needed to follow the instructions to the T.     After using the K18 Peptide Detox Shampoo, I partially towel-dried my hair, then applied a small amount, a little over a teaspoon, to the middle and ends. After exactly four minutes, I added my styling products and began the blow-drying process. What immediately stuck out was how my hair felt coated, but not heavy. I feared the results would be stringy, clumped together strands, and that I would soon be re-washing my hair. But what happened was the opposite. The mask gave my hair a certain weight, without weighing it down. It helped to smooth, without appearing oily. Still, the next couple of days would be telling; would I wake up to a greasy mess?  Surprisingly, no - even after a couple of days, my hair retained its appearance without the aid of dry shampoo or other products. After the initial period of using after every shampoo, I now incorporate it once a week to maintain my hair health. What I love most about this is that it works double duty; it nourishes and aids in styling. For someone with thin, fine hair, that is a rare and treasured combination, earning it high marks and my recommendation.

Licensed hair dresser here. After reading some of the bad reviews I thought I should jump in to explain some things.   This is a repair mask that you leave in. But this is not the same as a normal leave in conditioner. Once you apply this to your hair (do not exceed the amount instructed) and the 4 minutes have passed you need to follow up with your regular leave in products. This is not a heat protector nor meant to be your styling product.  You should only use this consecutively for 4-6 washes depending on the condition of your hair. If you use this too much you will be adding too much protein to your hair and it will feel like straw (the over use of the olaplex mask can also do this to your hair). Once you’ve surpassed 4-6 washes, this should only be used for maintenance. So use this maybe once a week or even once every two weeks.   If your hair feels dry and brittle and you’re not using any products in your hair to add hydration and moisture, it is normal for your hair to feel that way. Most products that are meant to repair the hair are meant to strengthen, not hydrate or moisturize. After reading the ingredients, I do not see any hydrating or really moisturizing agents listed. (Olaplex alone is the same which is why you have to buy the entire line in order for it to work properly)  This product works. I use this on my baby fine, dry, curly hair. I do not wear my hair curly. I blowdry and style after every wash. I have noticed a big difference after using this treatment. But this treatment alone is not going to work miracles. There is no repairing conditioning mask on the market that is able to do that.   This brand has a whole education section on their website if anyone feels confused about what this mask is supposed to do because the description on here is very vague and does not paint the whole picture.  I hope this information helps!

reviews.review_text: Ok, so, I never got on the Olaplex bandwagon for one reason or another. Their technology has been used in products at a far lower price point. But when the hype around this leave-in repair treatment started up, I was intrigued. I first purchased this last year and now I am on my 3 refill. When I say I cannot live without this, I am NOT lying. I use it every time I wash (recently picked up both of their shampoos), I allow my hair to airdry for 20 minutes or so, warm up 1 pump in my palms and apply starting at the ends and working my way up to the roots. This has never left my hair feeling weighed down or lifeless (except when I experimented using two pumps) and it's easier to style and the immediate results are shocking. I have noticed great improvements in my hair health since incorporating this in to my routine. Even when using their more intense clarifying shampoo (the detox) which leaves my hair a little ratty and unmanageable, as soon as this is applied I am left with hair that feels repaired and uncompromised.  I've never been one for hair masks or treatments and 98% of conditioners leave my hair feeling weighed down and waxy. I am so glad I found this!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been waiting to write this review because I wanted to do a simple cost-analysis, so let's get to it! First off, I have no idea about the amount of product that comes out of 1 pump even though that would've made the math easier. I could have measured it with a teaspoon or something, but I didn't want to waist any product. Second, I shared my first bottle with my sister. So I decided the sensible way to analyse the cost of this first bottle was to track usage over time. Usage here refers to how often we used the mask. You should know that between the 2 of us, we were using an average of 2-3 pumps per use. Both my sister and I differ in thickness (mine being thinner out of the 2 of us), and hair lengths varied while using this bottle. Generally, when our hair was longer we used more pumps vs when we had short hair.  The cost results?! After taxes, 1 bottle costs $3.59/use. It lasted us 11 months! If we want to look as cost per pump, we're looking (roughly) $1.20 to $1.80/pump (again, roughly).  As for the hair results, my sister and I couldn't be happier with! Our texture is SO soft after using this. Obviously other haircare techniques will help with maintaining great texture (using oils before washing/brushing, sleeping on silk, etc.), so this product can't do the job alone. But no product can.  Is this mask a necessity? Not for people with minimally damaged hair. But for the price of $3.59 per use over 11 months (know that my sister and I stretch the time suggested by the company to 5-6 washes in-between uses), why not try it for fun?!

reviews.review_text: I bought the Mini, as I could not bring myself to spend the full price and end up with it not working. My hair felt weighed down and heavy. Products with oil in them seem to be the culprits.  Second: A little bit does go a really long way! I have not used much of the mini after about 8 applications. Third: I notice a difference. My hair is softer and seems to be a little healthier, BUT, I cannot really tell if it is this product or the new products I have been using or a combination of all of them. Also, while I do notice a difference, it is not a huge difference - not enough for me to run out and buy more.  Last: The application is so weird - I have NEVER washed my hair and not conditioned in the shower. Ever. Period. It seems so wrong to shampoo and then get out of the shower. The first time I did this treatment, I shampooed in the shower, and then lightly towel dried my hair so that it was not dripping with a microfiber towel. I honestly did my skin care routine and then applied this to my hair. My wet hair without conditioner felt wrong and gross, however, once I applied this, my hair felt right again and conditioned. I waited the 4 minutes before adding other product and styling as recommended.   Overall, will i buy more - maybe but probably not right away. Frizz has diminished as well. I used a clarifying shampoo the first time as they suggest. I have lots of long fine hair, so not using a conditioner made me cry, but I wanted to use it as they direct. I took my time and brushed my hair out (Dae brush..amazing!)…it took a long time but I got through it.  I then split my hair in two and applied 2 pumps to each side. I scrunched it up first then ran my fingers through it (Abby Yung has good tips). Left in in for 4 min then applied Olaplex 6 mixed with 7 and blow dried. Next time I am going to do 1-1 1/2 pumps and maybe less of the leave in, because my hair wasn’t as dry.  I wash 1-3 times a week and I am going to do 6 consecutive washes then go into maintenance (or use as I want).  My hair is highlighted. I use Pureology hydrate shampoo. If you wanted to rinse and apply regular conditioner you can after 4 min. To my knowledge this works for the inside of your strands not the outside and it takes 4 min to reach where it’s supposed to go. But honestly using a leave in is fine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: You need this in your life!!! I will never lie about my reviews so believe me when I say you need this!! reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: In response to the negative reviews, let me just say this: 1) More than likely, they are using the product wrong. After putting in the product for 4 minutes, you can add leave in condition or whatever you usually add after for hydration ( I don't recommend washing it out) 2) People are saying there is only little product, but that's not the case. With one or 2 pumps in your hand, rub your hands together like you would soap. It eventually turn into a thicker lotion-like consistency. ( I didn't know this either. I watched a video from k18 to show me) 3) Use clarifying shampoo before  Back to my review. I have 4c hair. I hadn't flat ironed my hair in 4 years and went to a salon to get a silk press. huge mistake! She fried my hair out! after 2 washes my hair still smelled like it was on fire! I cried and was so close to chopping it all off. My tight coils were gone and my hair went from 4c to 3b/c. Went back to the salon to get redone by someone else and they used olaplex no 3. It made it a little better but I still had horrible split ends and my hair was falling out terribly. it was weak and brittle.   I used K18 ONE TIME and MY COILS CAME BACK! WITH JUST ONE APPLICATION...IM STILL SHOCKED! I CRIED I WAS SO HAPPY! Since I didn't know that I could make the product thicker by rubbing my hands together, I used 8 pumps which is wayyyy too much! I could've gotten away with using just 4 or 5, if that. After apply k18, I waited 4 minutes and then put hyaluronic hair lotion by Bumble and Bumble first, followed by leave in conditioner for bond repair by Bumble and Bumble. My hair is noticeably stronger and stopped falling out. it's also made my usual leave in products feel much softer in my hair. My hair isn't completely 100 percent but it has done an amazing job so far with just 1 use. I did NOT expect these results based on poor reviews but I gave it a shot and SO GLAD I DID! If your hair is noticeably damaged, believe me you WILL SEE RESULTS! Just be sure to apply it right.

I followed the instructions of washing with clarifying shampoo only, splitting my hair into 6 sections when wet, and applying 1-2 pumps to each section. Then I would brush it out gently to distribute the product. I don’t know if I’m not using enough because I do have thick/ long hair and there’s not really any indicators of how much is too much/ too little per person based on hair amount.  I’m scared of using too much because of potential protein damage so some clarity would be welcome! I enjoy the smell and texture of the product.

reviews.review_title: If you struggl with skipping conditioner read this
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was skeptical with the idea of skipping the conditioner after shampoo because I have type 4b/4c hair. Which means that I cannot make my hair manageable without using conditioner (I actually use hair masks because conditioners are not rich enough for me). This was until I saw Abbey Yung YT video in which she explains she contacted the company and asked if it was possible to use conditioner AFTER the application of K18 and the company said it can be used like that.  So I finally bought this product! I detox shampoo my hair first, towel dry and apply 4 pumps after sectioning my hair in 4. Let it sit for 4 minutes and then go back in the shower and apply a hair mask, then rinse off and continue with my haircare routine. K18 isn’t supposed to rinse off with water and I find this the only reasonable way to use this product effectively while avoiding to have my hair looking like a nest because of skipping conditioner. So far I’m happy with the results I see (I only used the product 3 times because I’m not a frequent washer). I have very fine and fragile african hair and I put a lot of heat on it and my hair has been looking pretty good and healthy lately. Will definitely leave another review after using the product for a bit longer but so far I’m happy with the result as my hair seems very healthy despite all the tortures I do to it lol

When i bought it from sephora or straight from their website it would make my hair feel amazing when used in moderation. I began to only use it 2 times a month at most so that i wasn’t stressing my hair with the strong ingredients. My hair is around mid waist length and is on the finer side for reference.  2 days after using k18, i was happy and thought it was working wonders for my hair. i thought it was a step up from olaplex like i’ve seen some others say. I loved the smell and i felt like it made the flyaways less apparent. The first 1-2 uses made my hair feel more soft as well.  It started to feel a little drying by the third use. After showering a couple days later after the third use, i put my 4th application in. I was drying my hair infront of a fan gently combing my fingers throughout my hair. I noticed my hair felt like it was drying slower than usual, and it felt a bit more tangled/rough than usual?  I then felt a noticeable chunk of hair in the back of my head that seemed more damaged than the rest of my hair. I dragged my hand down from the root of my head to the bottom of that section, where i had discovered that it broke off multiple inches down from my root. I never have noticed that prior to starting the k18 treatment. I’m pretty sure i would have noticed that level of breakage if i had it prior to using k18..  This is the first time since going platinum that i’ve ever gotten significant breakage, especially in one area. I highly do not recommend this product for girls with bleached hair (especially fine hair), since i’m almost certain it’s what broke my hair off.

reviews.review_text: I have been using this product regularly for about 4 months (4 times in a row, then about once every 3-4 washes) and it has made a HUGE difference! I have a ton of thick, fine, pin-straight blonde hair (naturally level 7-7.5) that a hairdresser fried about 3 years ago. I've been using a ton of products to get it back to its original strength, namely Olaplex, but I noticed my hair was developing a weird texture with it. I used a clarifying shampoo and decided it's time to try something new.  In comes K18. I have no idea how this product works so well, but it has been life-changing for me. No more weird texture, no sitting around for hours with Olaplex all over my head, and you can apply leave-ins/other products and style right after the 4 minutes are up. Every time I use this, I'm shocked at how soft and manageable my hair is, especially considering I didn't even use conditioner.   I got full highlights for the first time in roughly 6 months last week, and my hairdresser was blown away at how little damage I had. As she was blowdrying my hair, she kept showing me the round brush in amazement that not a single hair had snapped and no hairs were coming out onto the brush. I have been getting highlights for close to 15 years, and my hair has not felt this way since the first time I got them done in middle school. I seriously cannot believe how healthy my hair looks.  Is it expensive? Yes. Is it worth it? YES. I wish I had found this years ago - it would've saved me so much time and money from all of the different treatments I've tried. I will never buy another bottle of Olaplex again. Obviously I can't speak for other hair types/concerns, but if you're someone who's experienced bleach damage in the past, you must try K18!

reviews.review_title: Repairs, but process not for color treated hair
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to wait to write a review of this K18 mask. It seemed too good to be true, and in several ways it is.  Pros: Hair fees stronger and less damaged  No need to use conditioner in shower Seems to mitigate damage  Cons: In order for product to penetrate hair and provide optimal results, you must use clarifying shampoo beforehand, which has a tendency to dry out hair and create tangles.  Using clarifying shampoo strips colored hair over time, requiring more visits to the salon.   That said, it can bring damaged, brittle hair back to life… at the expense of stripping color and moisture from hair. If color fade isn’t a concern for you, this might be a great product for you. I plan on going back to Olaplex 3 and using k19 after my monthly clarifying shampoo.

I have the smaller bottle and used about 2 pumps, rubbed into my hands, then all over the hair. I then brushed it through. After the 4 minutes I used my bumble and bumble leave in and kerastase blow dry cream and blow dried and styled it. I typically can’t wear my hair straight because it looks so damaged but this a game changer. I’ve used olaplaex in the past and it did nothing for me.

reviews.review_text: WOW is all I can say. After a single use I already know I will never be without this product for the rest of my days. But this… I don’t know what kind of voodoo magic they’ve got in this stuff, but it just added so much moisture, bounce and body to my hair, my ends are no longer frizzy AT ALL. See for yourself! reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I redeemed my points for a sample of this on an order and this is the only thing that's really helped my hair. I saw the reviews and have been wanting to try this for a while. Even my husband asked if I had my hair done because it looks so much better. I am looking forward to using this regularly and seeing how great it can make my hair. I didn't even have to use any other leave ins or styling products other than this and my brush. Thank you k18!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am 100% rebuying this product.  (this is a bit long, sorry!)   I have been dying my hair for years and this past year I had been getting professional highlights. My fine long hair was getting fried.  Olaplex was working for me but it's a slow process to get results. I heard about k18 and I decided to give it a try.    I reached out to the company to see if the shampoos I had were compatible ( I heard you have to be careful that the shampoo you use with this product does not have silicone's, or ingredients that will block the products ability to penetrate into your hair) So once I heard back from the customer service I went in for the first try.   It was shampoo, rinse well, towel dry and bit, than apply the product.  I used 4 pumps of the trial size bottle ( the large bottle gives more product per pump but all the information about how much they suggest to use is on thier website) I let the product sit in my hair for 4 minutes and I was scared but didn't apply conditioner as they reccomend. I figured I'd risk it and see what happened. I lost faith that my hair would be manageable so I did end up putting Olaplex no.9 and then a little Olaplex Oil no.7 in my hair. It dried and wow! My hair looked and felt so nice and healthy.   I've done 3 treatments now and I love the way my hair looks and feels.  I have been taking a break from heat styling and I love the way my hair has turned out all 3 times. I plan on continuing up to the 6th application as they suggest and than using K18 every 3rd or 4th wash.  Nothing has made my hair this nice.  I save time without masks, conditioners and long treatments. My hair dries faster and nicer. I don't know what my long term results will be but I'm excited to find out.

reviews.review_title: Great for my fine, color treated hair
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this product from my salon after my last color treatment a few months ago, but I’m excited to see it’s available on Sephora. I use it every 3 shampoos, per my colorist’s advice. It has noticeably changed my hair over the last 3 months. It feels healthier, stronger, and less brittle. I’m a fan!  It’s expensive, but for me a little goes a long way. I have long hair and it only takes 1 pump to go through all of my hair. (I do have fine hair)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: A lot of friends in hairdressing had told me about this product & how it transforms your hair to its “original virgin state” - I was sold! For reference: I get my hair highlighted every 6-8 weeks.  I’ve tried it over 5 times now & my hair seems to be more and more dry each time I use it. It looks almost more damaged than it did when I started using it plus so many new fly aways! Everyone is different & I see many have had success with this - but it is NOT for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been getting K18 treatments done at my salon when I color my hair and I’ve noticed such an improvement in the overall health of my hair so I started buying it from Sephora to do at home. I suspect the negative reviews are due to people using this who don’t need more protein in their hair. Seriously, you need to figure out how much protein vs moisture your hair needs before trying a product like this. Yes it’s not technically a protein treatment but it gives your hair more of the building blocks of proteins so it’s essentially the same. If your hair is dry and brittle after using K18 then your hair needs more moisture, not a product like this!!! Also, if your hair gets matted if you don’t use conditioner I would try a cowash with this product or a more gentle cleanser. It’s a great product but it’s not for everyone. It can be heavy on your hair so I don’t like to add too many products after. I also notice more of an improvement after I’ve washed it out and it has had a chance to work it’s magic.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Background info: My hair type is fine, dense, level 7/8ish natural with bleached platinum blonde and 2A or possibly B curl. It’s long, maybe 20”. I’m a longtime user of olaplex and Brazilian bond, my hair responds very well to protein every 2 weeks or more if I’m swimming a lot or recently got my hair bleached.   Like many reviewers I was hesitant to try this, given the instructions. My hair tangles/knots atrociously after showering and I have to majorly saturate it with oil and curl creams to even think about brushing it. never mind without conditioner! I had just been swimming and my hair was stripped of all its toner, protein treatments and moisture. I used Briogeo super moisture shampoo (no silicones). My hair felt awful and was very dry and tangled at this point, which is typical for me before I condition. I hesitantly got out of the shower and tried to blot my hair with a t shirt. I then applied the entire sample size tube to my hair, a small amount at a time. i did my best to really work it in, but it was tough with all the tangles and knotting. My hair felt stiff and dry, not less tangled at all. I was pretty worried and nearly got in the shower to rinse it out. I waited 5 minutes and it felt the same, still. I then added my usual curl cream (moroccan oil) and the olaplex oil. Those made my hair feel a bit better and I was able to loosely brush through some of it, very gingerly.   Then…. my hair dried. and Wow. For real my hair is soooo shiny. shinier than it has been in years of color services. It also feels so soft and has superior texture. I cannot express how shocked I am at the luster of my strands right now. It’d be tough for me to shell out 75 bucks for this but….. I might have to. I had to use the whole sample on my hair. There were some spots I wasn’t able to get the product on, they’re visibly more frizzy than the ends where I was really able to work it in. So if you have a lot of hair, this is probably one of the most expensive hair products.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My hair: fine but I have a lot of it and I have highlights My environment: I tried this in the summer in a humid climate The good: it smells nice The bad: this product (when following instructions) tangled my hair, dried it out, it felt like straw and it felt like a layer of product was just sitting on top of my hair, I could feel something gritty (no matter the amount I used, very little or more). I used this 3 times (each time the hair was drier and drier) before adding conditioner to the routine (not according to instructions), this helped but STILL my hair was drier than without this product. This is where I drew the line and stopped using it.   The lovely scent isn't enough to offset all the negative effects of this product.

reviews.review_title: It actually CHANGED my hair, the science is real
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was hopeful but cautious. In my 45 years of being a beauty geek, I've tried a LOT OF HAIR MASKS & conditioners.   My hair is damaged (chemically), dry, mostly fine, and i have a TON of it. I get it permanently straightened, which damages it but actually helps it be brushable. It's now grown out a ways and the zig-zag curl pattern outgrowth is a nightmare to brush out, even when the majority of my hair is straight. I've tried leave in's, olaplex products, oils etc. Helpful, but I have to say...  THERE IS NOTHING LIKE THIS on the market. I know the technology is new & they DID IT. I have applied this exactly twice and my hair feels TRANSFORMED. I am not being hyperbolic. It really is different. It's easier to brush (which is the biggest thing to me, as I get little knots and rats nests all up in there after sleeping, that are so painful, I sometimes just put it in a bun so I don't have to deal). But it's wild. My hair looks UNDAMAGED. Healthy.   After the first application I was like 'wait... my hair... FEELS DIFFERENT. Not 'coated in quality conditioner' different. But ACTUALLY different. It changed my hair. For real.   It doesn't feel like i've left anything in my hair. My hair feels clean and soft. Not heavy or sticky or anything like that at all.  I'm gonna just say it, this is basically a miracle.   While a miracle is WORTH the money for sure, this is very pricey and I used 1/3 of the large jar on my hair each application. I do have a TON of hair, and it's down to my butt. So this is an investment. And I will be making it again. That's how good it is.  This is a repair mask... not sure if it's suitable for non-chemically damaged hair, so know that going in. This isn't just 'for dryness'. I believe in using the correct products for your hair type.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Please read my review! This product is the Holy Grail. Anybody who writes a review saying otherwise, simply isn't using it correctly. The first step when using this product is to shampoo your hair, and skip the conditioner. Sounds crazy right? Well, in order for this product to penetrate the hair you need to use a silicone free shampoo. I repeat, use a silicone free shampoo! A lot of clarifying shampoo still have silicone in it.... Just shop around and find a silicone free one. You're better off using dish soap rather than a shampoo that has silicone in it, because then you're just wasting your money on this product if you aren't going to strip your hair before using it. Your hair will be a tangled mess, especially if you have baby fine hair like me. But this product will work and you'll eventually be able to detabgle your hair after a few minutes! After you shampoo and towel dry your hair... Just leave it a tiny bit damp... When you use a pump or two of this product, rub it together in the palms of your hands and it turns into a very watery consistency. Start working it into your strands starting at the ends, then working your way up. You will instantly feel your hair get softer, and should be able to detangle it after a few minutes. The important thing during this part is to let the product sit in your hair for a full four minutes before adding any additional hair product. You just let it sit in your hair and basically soak into the hair. I have been using olaplex ever since it came out, I have tried every Bond Building Products including Redken, Bumble and Bumble, Brazilian Bond Builder, Etc. This product is different. If you use a shampoo first with silicone, emulsifying wax, Polyquaternium, or any type of silicone at all then you probably will not see results with K18. The most important thing is to use a shampoo that isn't going to leave any residue or coating on your hair whatsoever, so that the K18 can always penetrate your hair strands.

Dry, weird, I felt like my roots got greasy quicker, I was so confused. For reference, I usually air dry my hair. I was so disappointed, and was like, This is not for me. But I bought the bottle, so I'm going to give it the full 4-6 washes in a row, like it says. Cut to my 7th wash, and I went to blow-dry and style my hair for an event, and READER WHEN I TELL YOU. reviews.review_text: Fun fact: My first round of highlights were courtesy of my cousin after she completed cosmetology school in, yikes, 1985 (I think. After all, it was the 80s.) For the better part better part of 30+ years, I’ve been doing some serious damage, so getting a chance to use K18’s Leave-in Molecular Repair Hair Mask was a no brainer.  ❤️Repairs Your Hair: That’s one whale of claim, and K18 sets out to heal the hair both externally and internally. Instead of treating the cuticle (like regular conditioner) and the cortex (like bond builders) K18 goes to work on the cortical cells. Science-y lingo aside, I hear “repair,” “heal,” and “inside.” That’s new to me.  ❤️Results on Day One: I followed all the rules: freshly shampooed hair without using traditional conditioner. I used two pumps and coated my damp strands then waited about five minutes before combing out my hair. After blow drying, my hair was the softest it has been in years. It also felt sleek as if I had flat-ironed it.   ❤️Consistent Results When Used With Various Shampoos: Out of curiosity, I rotated my shampoos to see how K18 worked with each one. Whether it was a salon or celebrity brand, everyday, clarifying or moisturizing formula, the K18 consistently left my hair soft and silky. The hair texture was the biggest tell. My hair is very fine, but I have to flat iron it to get it completely straight. Not on my K18 days, though. The hair laid smoother and straighter with a simple blow dry session, which shortened my routine and helped me avoid further damage due to heat styling.  ❤️The Bottom Line: If you bleach, color, or use hot styling tools, K18 will improve your hair’s condition long-term. It’s not a quick fix; it’s a hair health booster. Bonus: It also softens the coarse gray hairs I obviously have. They may be hidden among the highlights, but their texture pre-K18 tells me I’m more gray than I realize … but I ain’t worrying about it with this in my routine.   Perfect in every way!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have very fine, highlighted blonde hair, about shoulder length that is greasy at the roots and VERY dry and damaged/breaking on the ends. I’ve been using olaplex 3 for years, and while I saw good day-after results from it, it seemed pretty short lived. This however… I used it for every wash for 2 weeks (I only wash 2x a week, so 4x in a row…) first few times I didn’t notice much, but after the fourth wash I was actually noticing significantly less breakage and visible damage. Which has never happened before! First time I used it I don’t think I put enough in and my hair felt a bit dry. Then, using more, I’ve noticed way better moisture/strength results, but it DOES make my hair way more waxy/greasy. But for healthier hair… I’ll take it. I use it with a shower cap after I put it on and leave it for a good 10 mins in there, before putting other products in. I then let it air dry in braids. Took a star off for the weight/waxyness and for the price… but it actually works!

reviews.review_text: The tldr version: follow the instructions and it’s the type of science that seems like magic.  Typically I don’t write reviews but there were so many incentivized ones and it’s pretty pricey so thought I’d throw my two cents in here.  For context/comparison I use olaplex, the whole system when I feel inspired and just the #3 and #8 when I’m feeling lazy (which admittedly is more often than not) and at $28/bottle per bottle it may technically be cheaper but it’s a multiple bottle system so it gets pretty comparable in price fast.   I’ve used this twice and the first time I used a clarifying shampoo, no conditioner, and then went in with towel dried/ damp hair with about a pump and a half (mid-back length, fine, not very thick, bleached hair). I was a bit worried my hair seemed maybe a bit dry, crunchy? So after the “4 minutes to activate” I added some of my normal hair serum and it felt mostly normal. Air dried, brushed and it looked like how I Wished my hair would air dry (you know, blow dried smooth but still with a bit of body but not like it was blown out). I slept on it and it still looked as good as it did when I went to sleep.   Fast forward to second wash, everything the same, but my hair felt better (likely bc it’s more repaired), so didn’t add anything extra this time. My not-trimmed-in-year hair now looks darn near like I had a fresh trim a month ago.   It’s admittedly weird to not condition and I would love if the K18 had a bit more slip, so definitely pre-brush your hair before shampooing and try not to tangle too much in the drying process, I use a hair towel which helps a lot.   This is honestly so easy to use, takes so much less time than traditional hair masks, and has such visible results, I will definitely buy again.

I have also used this product on my daughter's hair which is constantly getting knots. She claims that her hair is much easier to brush through and hurts less than before we started using this on her. FYI, this product is recommended to use the first 4 times consecutively but after that, you can use this product once a week or more sporadically to maintain results. Based on other hair masks, I typically use a bottle this size (larger one) two or three times before running out because of my long hair.
